The date of the incident when Martin was arrested and died, as he was taken into custody early Saturday, with the timeline leading to his death on the same day.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline of the incident: Martin was arrested and died on the same day, which underscores the suddenness and tragedy of the event.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back, died after a brief struggle with police during a detaining process for a suspected break-in in Oakland.
Martin was a highly regarded player, known for his performance with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including being a first-round draft pick in 2012 and a Pro Bowl and All-Pro selection.
The incident sparked public attention and concern around police interactions with individuals, especially those with a history of public visibility or fame.
The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, emphasizing Martin’s status as a local figure and community member.
No cause of death has been released, and an autopsy is pending, reflecting ongoing uncertainty and potential public interest in the circumstances.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, best known for his career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police officers during an investigation into a break-in at a home in Oakland. The incident occurred on Saturday, October 6, 2025, and Martin was transported to a hospital where he passed away at 36. The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, acknowledging Martin’s status as a local community figure and former All-Pro. While the exact cause of death has not been released, an autopsy is scheduled. Martin, selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft, had a notable career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, and was named first-team All-Pro and Pro Bowl selection multiple times.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention in Oakland
